thread.title: Tottenham 2-2 Gent: Player ratings as Harry Kane own goal caps poor display | Metro News
thread.title_full: Tottenham 2-2 Gent: Player ratings as Harry Kane own goal caps poor display | Metro News

author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Tottenham 2-2 Gent: Player ratings as Harry Kane own goal caps poor display | Metro News
text:
Follow us Tottenham 2-2 Gent player ratings: Harry Kane has a shocker as Spurs dumped out of Europa League Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 10:04 pm Tottenham suffered an embarassing Europa League exit (Picture: Getty) 
Tottenham drew 2-2 with Gent and suffered a 3-2 defeat on aggregate to the Belgian side as they exited the Europa League at Wembley tonight. 
Spurs fielded a strong side after losing the first leg 1-0 last week, but put in another disappointing performance in Europe that has been the theme of their season. Keep smiling! Mourinho of all people melts hearts with touching message to Ranieri 
Christian Eriksen had a good game and got Tottenham off to precisely the start they wanted with an early goal at Wembley, slotting home from close range after a defensive mix-up from the visitors. 
However, the lead lasted barely ten minutes as Gent equalised through a rather comical own goal headed past Hugo Lloris by Spurs striker Harry Kane. Victor Wanyama’s strike gave Spurs hope (Picture: Getty) 
The first half went from bad to worse for the north Londoners, who went down to ten men in the 39th minute as Dele Alli’s wreckless challenge saw him rightly sent off.
